Ragnar turned to Katya and nodded.

Ragnar: I will go and warn Rodimus of the outcome of this trial.

He walks away, making the ground tremble slightly with every step.

Katya: He sees true in your potential. You are strong. However, being 
a Clansman... err... Clansbot in your case, that is more than 
techniques. It is a lot of training, and probably a major change of 
minds. We Clans value zellbringen, single combat. Even in a melee, we 
tend to engage no more than one enemy at the time. Also, honor is 
above everything else in every aspect of our life... except maybe 
politics, but that is easily answered through combat. Are you willing 
to become a Clan Warrior?

--- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> Owlhawk braced himself and put his hands in front of
> him to absorb most of the shock of running into the
> wall.  Then he stood up and faced them.
> 
> Owlhawk:  Verywell, I'm open to new techniques.
> 
> --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > The punch threw the female warrior far away. As she
> > tried to get up, 
> > she could not totally conceal her pain.
> > 
> > Katya: I applaud you, Owlhawk. You do have the
> > Wolf's soul and the 
> > Bear's strenght. You have bested me in this contest.
> > We will work as 
> > part of the Maximals as of now.
> > 
> > Ragnar's towering form came next to her.
> > 
> > Ragnar: You are a powerful warrior, Owlhawk, and I
> > have been thinking. 
> > I believe that you could serve the Maximals even
> > better if we steep 
> > you in the ways of the Clans. If Katya does not
> > agree, I will be your 
> > trainer. What say you?
> > 
> > 
>
